direction.raw_text: . They're probably gonna make me a manager after Christmas so I can handle the payments if you just leave the house-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He gets in the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Call me when you have the balloon payment. He makes a circle in the air with his hand and the semi's rev their engines and grind into reverse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll call you... Her voice is DROWNED OUT by REVVING engines. Ricky rushes to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait, where are they going? She takes his face in her hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen to me. We'll get them back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But why are they leaving?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ricky, I'll get them back. I promise, honey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's our house! He BREAKS AWAY from her and RUNS down the road chasing after the semis. Ray chases after Ricky until he runs out of steam and stops, panting. She catches up to him and tries to hug him. He pushes her away. She gets down on her knees and takes his face in her hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're gonna get it back. She picks him up and walks back to the trailer. Ricky looks out mournfully at the trailers disappearing down the road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to T.J.) You better hurry or you're going to miss the bus. Let's get your clothes on, Ricky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . T.J. just stares at her. T.J. I can get a job you know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're 15, T.J. T.J. They won't ask any questions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're finishing school. T.J. Come on, you don't think we can live on what you make at All for a Dollar do you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're going to school. She goes inside.   T.J. follows. T.J. I bet I could make more than you do. She ignores him. 6   INT. RAY'S TRAILER - DAY                                    6 Ray helps Ricky into his clothes and puts his backpack on his back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's daddy? Ray and T.J. look at each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He'll be back. T.J. Aren't we even gonna look for him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No! I'm going to work and you're going to school. T.J. That's it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The only thing that changed is that your dad started gambling again. Everything else is the same.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where did he go?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He had to take a business trip. T.J. rolls his eyes. T.J. Aren't you even gonna look for him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And miss a day of work? No. Not again. We just have to live our lives. Now go get your backpack. T.J. stares, sullen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go on!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When is daddy coming home?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know, Ricky. T.J. I can't believe you're not even gonna look for him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where? Where do I look? (He can't answer) T.J. The reservation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told you, he could be in Atlantic City by now. She helps Ricky get his backpack on and gives him a kiss. T.J. (shakes his head) The glove compartment. That's so stupid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're going to school.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He follows Ricky out the door to catch the school bus rolling up out front. Suddenly, Ray remembers:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait, wait. They turn around. She digs in her pockets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here. Lunch money. They take it and keep running for the bus. Ray looks after them and reaches for her cigarettes. She takes out her second to last one. She lights it and takes out her mascara. She tries to put it on the bathroom mirror, but her tears keep getting in the way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 7   INT. ALL FOR A DOLLAR STORE - DAY                              7 RAY stacks shelves with a knock-off version of plastic "My Little Pony" in a messy aisle of boxes. MATT, 22, her boss, bone thin with bad skin walks by.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Matt. Could I talk to you? He looks at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I need to come on full-time. Matt blinks with a blank expression then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I see you as a short timer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A short timer. Not here for long, not really committed. Ray follows him to the stock room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When I started you said it would be six months before I could come on full-time. And that was two years ago. He opens a can of RED BULL and takes a sip.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's my opinion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I mean, you know, I do show up. Pat's late everyday. She's late now. She's always late. He stares blankly at her. She can think of nothing else to say. He walks out. Ray resumes unpacking ponies. A moment later PAT, 22, rushes in, looking sorry. As Pat hangs up her coat, Ray glimpses a tatoo just above her low riding pants with the words "How You Doin'?". Ray takes the last of her cigarettes out of the pack and heads out the back door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See ya' tomorrow. 8   INT./EXT HORIZON,   ROUTE 37 - DAY                             8 Ray drives down a two-lane highway. It is empty flat land but for a few trailer homes and barns. She passes a lonely sign: "BRIDGE TO CANADA." Up ahead another sign: "AKWESASNE LAND OF THE MOHAWK." From the car, the Reservation consists of shabby houses with no siding, tax-free gas stations and dive bars with homemade signs. Ray slows a little to check out the parking lots scanning for her husband's car. Up ahead she sees a sign: "WOLF MART TAX FREE GAS AND CIGARETTES. 9   EXT. WOLF MART GAS STATION - DAY                               9 Ray pulls in to the combo gas station, restaurant and mini mart.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . A MOHAWK TEENAGER wearing a bandana RUNS out to the CAR without a coat, rubbing his hands together to ward off the cold.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fill it up? She rolls down the window, digging for change under the seat of her car. She counts it out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just three...uh, no...two seventy one, two, three, four.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two seventy four. He nods and goes to the pump. She finds a wadded up five dollar bill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (yells out window) Make that seven seventy four. She spots a sign for "TRAILWAYS" bus in the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you see a Blue Acclaim come in here last night?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Blue Acclaim...no, but I only worked until 9 PM. You can ask inside. Ray glances inside at the mostly empty restaurant but for a few older Mohawk women.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, that's okay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you want to support our Mosquito Lacrosse League. It teaches basic Lacrosse skills to the kids three to five. Ray shakes her head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks, anyway. Have a good day.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 10   INT./EXT. ROUTE 37 INDIAN RESERVATION - DAY                 10 Ray continues down the highway through the reservation. She comes to a huge warehouse, the "MOHAWK BINGO PALACE." She glances over at the sea of cars surrounding it. At the end of a row she spots it: a BLUE ACCLAIM. Ray abruptly turns in. 11   EXT. MOHAWK BINGO PALACE PARKING LOT - DAY                  11 Ray pulls up alongside the Acclaim and recognizes it by the "EASY DOES IT" bumper sticker. She gets out and looks inside. There is a small plastic T- Rex on the floor of the backseat. She leans against the car for a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you. Oh God, thank you, thank you thank you... After a moment Ray looks up at the Bingo Palace and heads for the entrance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You son of a bitch! 12   INT. BINGO PALACE ENTRANCE -   DAY                          12 A SHORT, CHUBBY MOHAWK TICKET TAKER in her 60s, with piercing blue eyes and missing teeth sits perched on a metal chair beside a velvet rope.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sunrise session is almost over. Next session starts at 10:30.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just need to look inside. Ray starts to walks toward the door and the ticket taker sticks out her foot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's $5 dollars for admission.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't want to play, I just need to look around for a second.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm gonna need the five.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll stand right here at the door. I won't even go inside. I just need to see if my husband's in there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You still gotta pay admission.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's gambling away the money for our house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What does he look like?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Long brown hair. Tall. Skinny. Ponytail.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's not in there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I just look?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told you, lady, he's not in there. Ray walks away. The ticket taker watches her. 13   EXT. MOHAWK BINGO PALACE, PARKING LOT - DAY                13 Ray walks out of the front entrance back across the parking lot toward the Horizon through rows of cars... Across the parking lot, LILA LITTLEWOLF, 20, a Mohawk girl with long black hair bursts out of the "Employees Entrance" and hurries across the parking lot pulling off her scratch card apron as she walks. Ray catches sight of her, but before Ray reaches the Horizon, Lila reaches the ACCLAIM, GETS IN IT AND BACKS OUT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . But Lila drives off. Ray JUMPS back in the Horizon and TAKES OFF AFTER HER. 14   EXT. RESERVATION ROADS - DAY                                14 Ray follows the Acclaim down Route 37 and catches sight of it turning off on a dirt road. Ray makes the corner just in time to catch sight of the Acclaim bouncing off on a path through the woods. Ray follows it through the woods to a clearing: the Acclaim stops in front of a rusted out BUBBLE CAMPER. Lila gets out. Ray pulls up behind her and rolls down her window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's my car. Lila SPINS around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Huh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doing with my car? Lila fingers the keys in her hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That? I found it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You stole it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The keys were in it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So you just took it...? Lila goes in the bubble camper and shuts the door behind her. Ray gets out of the Horizon and walks up to the camper door and takes out her cell phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll just see what the troopers say about that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go ahead, they got no jurisdiction here. This is Mohawk territory. Ray stops dialing closes up her phone, then goes to her car and takes the gun and goes back to the camper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can cut the bullshit and give me my keys now. There is no reponse. Ray waits for a moment and then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Troy, are you in there? There is no response.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you're in there you better come out. 15   INT. LILA'S CAMPER - DAY                                    15 Lila sits on an army cot in the dingy camper next to a lamp on the floor. Her clothes are scattered among empty Pringles cans.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Troy? Versales says as long as we get the money in by Christmas we won't lose the deposit. (pause) I think we need to talk about this, so come on out.(Pause) Troy? Troy? 16   EXT. LILA'S CAMPER - DAY                                    16 Ray aims the gun and FIRES into the camper door. 17   INT. LILA'S CAMPER - DAY                                    17 The shock of the blast throws Lila off the cot. She looks at the SMOKING HOLE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not kidding, honey, come on out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 18   EXT. LILA'S CAMPER - DAY                                   18 Keeping behind the door for cover, Lila opens it. Ray looks inside: there is no sign of Troy.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is New York State so quit the bullshit and give me my damn keys! Lila throws the keys out the door. Ray picks them up off the ground. Lila shuts the door with her foot. 19   EXT. LILA'S CAMPER - DAY                                   19 Ray gets in the Horizon and pulls it in behind the Acclaim then digs in the trunk, pulling out a rope. She ties one end to the Acclaim's back fender and the other to the Horizon's front fender. Lila watches out the camper window. Ray gets in the Acclaim and starts it up slowly TOWING the Horizon a few feet before the rope SNAPS. Ray gets out and looks at the broken rope. She begins digging in the trunk for more rope. Lila opens the camper door and looks at the bullet hole.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This camper belongs to my brother in law. He won't like this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then you should quit stealing cars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought it was abandoned, the guy driving it got on a bus. Ray stops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you see where the bus was headed?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: New York or Buffalo, I'm not sure. Ray RE-TIES the tow line with the remaining rope. This time the Horizon goes an inch or two before the rope SNAPS. Ray gets out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (under her breath) Shit! Ray RIFLES through the trunk for more rope. "Home on the Range" plays on the cell phone in Ray's back pocket. Lila touches the bullet hole in the camper and listens to Ray's conversation from the doorway. Ray puts the phone back in her pocket and takes an old belt of her husbands and tries to attach the fenders of the cars. Ray gets back in the Acclaim and tries TOWING the Horizon once again. This time the right side of the front fender SNAPS OFF and droops to one side. Ray gets out and looks at Lila.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not leaving this here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (points at the Acclaim) I got a friend who might buy that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not for sale.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He'll pay more than it's worth. Ray ignores her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe two thousand.

direction.raw_text: Why's that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's always looking for cars with button- release trunks. Ray thinks about it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He don't need papers or anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Does he use them to rob banks or something? Lila shrugs.

direction.raw_text: All I know is he pays good for a car like this.

direction.raw_text: Where does he live?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Through the woods. Not far.

direction.raw_text: What's in it for you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He'll give me something for finding it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you try anything, I'm not afraid to use this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. 20   INT. ACCLAIM IN RESERVATION WOODS - DAY                 20 Ray drives with one hand and holds the gun with the other. It is pointed at Lila in the passenger seat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Turn up there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where that stump is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Ray makes the turn with one hand and the car bounces through an overgrown path in the woods. Ray reaches the stump.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's no road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's a path. Ray hesitates.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not far. Ray turns and drives into deeper woods. The gun jiggles around in Ray's hand as they bounce along between the trees. Lila tries to ignore it. 21   EXT. ACCLAIM AT BOAT RAMP - DAY                            21 The car emerges from the woods at a BOAT RAMP leading to a mile-wide section of the FROZEN ST. LAWRENCE RIVER. 22   INT. ACCLAIM AT BOAT RAMP - DAY                            22 Ray looks out at the ice. Tire tracks make a path across the snow-covered surface between carefully set out CUT EVERGREEN TREES.

direction.raw_text: That's Canada.

direction.raw_text: What about the border patrol?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's no border.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm still not crossing that.

direction.raw_text: Don't worry, it'll hold a Plymouth. I've seen semis cross it. Ray looks at Lila suspiciously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The only other way is the Cornwall bridge and they won't let you take that. (points at the gun). Suddenly, A TRUCK driven by a MOHAWK TEENAGER ROARS out of the woods and SWERVES around the Acclaim FISHTAILING then SPEEDING out across the ice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They plow it and everything. Cautiously, Ray lets off the brake and rolls down the boat ramp towards the smooth surface of the river.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is so fuckin' stupid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not too fast, there are ruts. 23   EXT. ACCLAIM ON FROZEN RIVER - DAY                          23 The Acclaim moves across the smooth surface of the river. 24   INT. ACCLAIM ON FROZEN RIVER - DAY                          24 Ray stares straight ahead clutching the wheel, barely breathing. Lila glances at the gun in Ray's hand, then out at the river, unfazed. They reach the midpoint of the river and pass it silently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You gotta pick up some speed to get up the bank.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Ray speeds up. The Acclaim bounces up the steep bank.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's just on the other side of those trees. 25   EXT./INT. ACCLAIM AT JIMMY'S GARAGE LOT- DAY               25 Ray and Lila pull into a used-car lot surrounded by a chain link fence. There is no sign of life. Ray stops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Honk the horn. Ray honks. Suddenly, from under a gutted truck, A HUGE BLACK DOG, part wolf, SPRINGS onto the hood of the Acclaim. Ray is pinned against her seat at the sight of the dog. Lila GRABS the gun out of her hand and points it at Ray.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just keep your mouth shut. Ray stares at the snarling dog.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just keep it shut. Okay? Ray nods never taking her eyes off the dog. Lila honks the horn again and keeps the gun low and out of sight. Out of the garage comes JIMMY, 33, a stocky Mohawk, eating a sandwich. Jimmy looks suspiciously at Ray before he sees Lila. Thunder growls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thunder! SHUT UP!. The dog GROWLS ferociously at Ray.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get back under there! Thunder jumps off the hood and disappears back under the trunk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Jimmy walks around to the passenger side of the car. Lila rolls down her window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi, Jimmy. Jimmy glances at Ray.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He don't like whites, Lila.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And your late.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I shouldn't even be dealing with you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know. Sorry. He hands her a paper bag. Jimmy goes back to the garage and opens the door. TWO YOUNG CHINESE MEN in cheap jogging suits follow him out, looking around. 26   INT. ACCLAIM JIMMY'S GARAGE LOT - DAY                       26 Lila hands the paper bag to Ray and points the gun at her, keeping it low and out of sight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Count it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's going on here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just count it. Ray opens the bag. It's full of cash. All fifties and hundreds. Ray counts it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How much is there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Twelve hundred. Lila opens the glove compartment and presses the trunk release. Jimmy motions to the Chinese men to get in the trunk. Jimmy shuts it. He taps twice on the hood of the car and walks back to the garage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Ray) Let's go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait, who the fuck are they?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just back up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not moving until those people get out of my trunk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll give you half. Now let's go. Jimmy turns around, sees the two women arguing and gets suspicious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's go!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not taking them over the border. That's a crime.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's no border here. This is free trade between nations.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This isn't a nation. Lila jams the gun into Ray's side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (under her breath) Let's go. Jimmy starts back toward the car. Ray puts the car in REVERSE and backs up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 27   EXT. ACCLAIM ON FROZEN RIVER - DAY                         27 The Acclaim drives down the bank onto the frozen river and starts across. 28   INT. ACCLAIM ON FROZEN RIVER - DAY                         28 Ray drives. Lila sits angled toward Ray with the gun trained on her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why'd your husband leave you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe he wanted a younger women. Ray stares out at the ice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's what usually happens. Ray says nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I never have to worry about that. My husband is dead. Went down in the river on a run. They never found him. Probably tangled in river weeds. She gives Ray a spooky look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You better slow down there are ruts out here. You could get stuck in one. Ray speeds up and roars up the boat ramp off the ice skidding a little. 29   EXT. ACCLAIM IN RESERVATION WOODS - DAY                    29 Ray and Lila bounce through the woods with Lila holding the gun, this time. They come to a dirt road then to an intersection with State Route 37. A SIGN READS: "YOU ARE LEAVING AKWESASNE, LAND OF THE MOHAWK".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 30   INT. ACCLAIM ON ROUTE 37 - DAY                             30 Ray slows down at the sign.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Keep going.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What if the troopers stop us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They won't stop you. You're white. Ray keeps going. 31   EXT. ROUTE 37, THE RESERVATION LINE - DAY                  31 Just beyond the Reservation line, partly hidden behind a barn, a NEW YORK STATE TROOPER VEHICLE sits parked. 32   EXT. BOB'S MOTEL, MASSENA, NEW YORK - DAY                  32 Ray pulls into a 1950s strip motel. A Pakistani man, the DEALER, looks out from the motel office. 33   INT. ACCLAIM AT BOB'S MOTEL - DAY                          33 Ray sees the Dealer hurrying towards them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pull around back then wait for him to come to the window. Lila keeps the gun low. The Dealer approaches cautiously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roll down your window. He walks up slowly and hands her a brown paper bag.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Count it. Ray opens the bag and counts out the cash, as before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Twelve hundred.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Lila takes the cash from Ray and pops the trunk release. The two Chinese men hurry out. The Dealer ushers them into a Garage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's go. 34   INT. ACCLAIM ON ROUTE 37 - DAY                             34 Ray and Lila return down Route 37 past the sign "AKWESASNE, LAND OF THE MOHAWK" Lila keeps the gun on Ray.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Turn down there. Ray looks at the dirt road leading into the woods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop here. Ray stops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now open the door. Ray hesitates. Lila jams the gun in her side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Open the door. Ray opens the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now get out. Ray doesn't move.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can't have my car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can't have my car. Lila tries to push Ray out the driver's door with her feet. Ray clings to the steering wheel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No! Suddenly, Ray grabs Lila by the hair and pulls her head down to the car seat. Lila hits Ray in the head with the gun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuckin' bitch! Bleeding and holding Lila's hair, Ray pries the gun out of Lila's hand. Lila grabs the sack of money, jumps out of the passenger side of the car and takes off into the woods. Ray chases her, but Lila is faster and gets ahead, then disappears into the woods. Ray stops, panting, and wipes the blood from her forehead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Little bitch! Ray stares after her for a long moment then gets back in the Acclaim. 35   EXT. RAY'S TRAILER YARD - DAY                              35 Ray drives up in the Acclaim. T.J., wearing PROTECTIVE GOGGLES, works on the broken Duck Kiddie ride with a BLOW TORCH. He doesn't notice Ray. Ray covers over the cut with her hair and gets out and walks up behind him and taps him on the shoulder. He jumps and cuts the flame.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told you not to use that thing when I'm not here. T.J. If I get it working I can sell it. She looks at the rusted pieces of it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't care. Don't use that thing when I'm not here!

direction.raw_text: Hey, you can lose the attitude. Anyway, Kmart was closed by the time I got off work. He gives her a sideways glance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's that smell? T.J. Popcorn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told you to be careful with the microwave, didn't I? T.J. Sorry. 103   INT./EXT. LILA'S CAMPER - NIGHT                            103 A heavy THUD as something hits the side of Lila's camper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bernie! She opens the door, but no one is there. At her feet she sees a Pringles can. In it: the cash she left at her mother-in-law's house for her son. She looks towards the woods but there is no sign of anyone. She shuts the door. Inside she digs through an old box of junk and pulls out a 2 foot long oval shaped wooden board, an infant board, and a blanket. She wraps her pillow in the blanket around the board in the Mohawk tradition and picks it up. She tries it on her back, then leans it against the wall, then hangs it on a hook on the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 104   INT. RAY'S TRAILER, KITCHEN - DAY                         104 Christmas Morning. Ray stands at the stove in her bathrobe making pancakes. T.J. helps Ricky set up his new Hot Wheels Set. A Knock at the door. Another knock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Daddy? Ricky runs to the door and opens it, then backs away. Trooper Napoli is there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is there a Ray Eddy here? Ray comes to the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I speak to you outside for a minute.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I haven't gotten the light fixed-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not about that. I just have a few questions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure. 105   EXT. RAY'S TRAILER YARD - DAY                             105 Ray slips on her boots, grabs her jacket around her and steps outside the trailer door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is about the woman who was with you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How long have you known her?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not too long. She looks after my kids.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's a smuggler.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wow. That's a shock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, well, there is that element on the Reservation I'm sure you know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, I've heard about it but I didn't know she was involved.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How did you happen to meet her?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh, I think there was a sign for a baby sitter at the Wolf Mart. That's where I get my gas.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just thought you should be aware of that. She's known to have smuggled illegal immigrants into the country.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh my God. He nods his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If I were you I'd find a new baby sitter. You don't want her around young kids.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Absolutely. He eyes the side of the trailer where smoke stained siding is visible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, you have an enjoyable Holiday.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks. You, too. Ray stands and watches the trooper drive away. She feels in the pocket of her bathrobe for her cigarettes and fumbles to light one, sucking on it, unaware of the cold. When she turns around she looks at the trailer and notices the smoke-stained siding on one end of it. 106   INT. RAY'S TRAILER - DAY                                  106 T.J. listens at the door. Ricky looks up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why is the police man here? T.J. Shh. From outside the door:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: T.J. could you come out here for a minute. T.J. goes outside. 107   EXT. TRAILER YARD - DAY                                   107 Ray stands staring at T.J. at the trailer's burnt end. T.J. What did he want? Did something happen to Dad?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. T.J. Then what did he want? She points to the blackened siding on the trailer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you have a fire last night? T.J. The pipes froze so I fixed `um.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You fixed um?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . T.J. Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you happen to use the blow torch? She walks around back and looks underneath the trailer: a mass of charred and melted insulation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look at this. We can't live here anymore! T.J. It's just a tin crapper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, it was our house. T.J. So, we're gettin' a new one, right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus, you could have killed yourself and your brother. She grabs the blowtorch and slams it to the ground, but it is indestructible. T.J. It's not yours, he gave it to me. She goes to the car, takes out her gun then puts the blow torch on the ground and aims at it -- but T.J. grabs it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Put it down. T.J. No!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Put it down. T.J. Are you gonna shoot me now, too?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Put that thing down! He ignites the blow torch to spite her. T.J. Maybe he didn't like gettin' shot in his own house. Maybe that's why he left.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That was an accident. T.J. Some accident you shot him in the foot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He spent the food money on scratch cards, T.J. T.J. So, he'd done it before. He aims it at her. She walks towards him. He increases the flame.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gimme that thing. She tries to grab it out of his hand, but he is too strong.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: T.J. come on now. T.J. You can't have it. It's mine. His eyes fill with tears, but his face stays tight. She grabs at it again, but he jerks it away. She pauses and stares at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He was clean for 23 months. They look at one another.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (chokes back tears) I didn't know how else to keep us together. I mean...he's a good dad when he's not gamblin'. He cuts off the blow torch. T.J. Yeah, awesome dad. Robs us and takes off a week before Christmas. She walks up to him and wipes a tear from the side of his face. He shakes it off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . They stand in the cold air for a long moment their breath visible. She touches his hair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 108   EXT. BUBBLE CAMPER - NIGHT                                 108 Ray drives up in the Acclaim. Lila and the Horizon are gone. She spots it in the distance behind the Bingo palace next to a dumpster. Ray parks and goes inside. 110   EXT. MOHAWK BINGO PALACE ENTRANCE - NIGHT                  110 The short chubby toothless Mohawk ticket taker perched on a metal stool beside a velvet rope. Ray sees her and begins to dig in her jeans for a five. The ticket taker looks her up and down, expressionless. Ray hands over the money. The ticket taker just looks at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The game's over. They're verifying the last winner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's okay. I still wanna buy a ticket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't sell you one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got money.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just want to buy some scratch cards.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go to Wolf Mart, they sell `um there. Ray walks away. The ticket taker watches her. 111   EXT. MOHAWK BINGO PALACE, PARKING LOT -    DAY             111 Ray slumps down in the driver's seat of the Acclaim waiting for Lila to come out. She is parked a few cars away from the Horizon. Other bingo players come out and get in cars surrounding Ray. Mohawks employees, including Lila come out of the "Employees Entrance". She starts toward Horizon. She wears new glasses. Catching sight of Ray in the Acclaim, she abruptly turns and starts walking in the opposite direction. Ray pulls out and drives over following her in the Acclaim.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I quit smuggling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: T.J. set the trailer on fire. Lila keeps walking. Ray drives along beside her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He didn't mean to, but the pipes froze and he got that damn torch out -- which I told him not to do touch when I wasn't there -- and he tried to thaw them out-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got glasses and now I can see up close.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's a hole in my bedroom floor. We gotta move.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Lila keeps walking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just need one more run to get the double. Lila keeps walking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look you can have the Acclaim. Okay? Lila keeps walking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't want it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it then?! Lila keeps walking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you still mad about that baby? `Cause it wasn't all my fault, ya' know. I mean who puts their kid in a duffle bag? Lila keeps walking. Ray follows trying to figure her out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're gonna need a lot of money to take care of a one year old baby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got enough.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, but you gotta get him first. Lila stops dead in her tracks and looks at Ray.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll help you. You can even borrow my gun. Lila looks around to see if anyone is watching and gets in the Acclaim with Ray. ANGLE FROM BINGO PALACE ENTRANCE: The Ticket Taker watches the Acclaim drive away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 112   EXT. ACCLAIM, VERSAILLES MOBILE HOME LOT - NIGHT           112 Ray and Lila pull up outside the model double wide home. 113   INT. ACCLAIM. VERSAILLES MOBILE HOME LOT - SAME            113 Ray and Lila look at it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You should see the inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How many bedrooms?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Three. And it's got a jacuzzi tub in the master bathroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wall to wall carpet?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh yeah. But the best thing is the insulation. The pipes can never freeze. Ray gets out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll be back. She disappears into the Office. Lila looks at the house. 114   INT. OFFICE, VERSAILLES MOBILE HOME LOT - NIGHT            114 Ray comes in on Guy Versailles giving a young couple the hard sell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...what I think you'll find with the Commodore -- and you'll be the judge -- is that the vinyl wall covering is perfect for small children. There is never a need to repaint or even touch up-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wanna schedule a delivery. Versailles looks up, annoyed. He plasters on a smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give me just a second. He tries to take Ray aside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you want? She pulls a huge wad of cash from her jacket pocket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is this all of it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's three thousand but I want it delivered tomorrow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told you all or nothing. She holds out the cash. The couple tries not to watch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take it as a deposit. All you have to do is show up. If I don't have the rest you keep it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can't argue with that. You'll have to sign something, though. He takes out a contract and writes in the deposit amount as thirteen hundred seventy two dollars owing. Ray signs the paper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 115   INT.   ACCLAIM ON FROZEN RIVER - NIGHT                     115 Ray drives down the boat launch and starts across. The sky is clear and the moon shines down on the white river surface. Downstream patches of the river have thawed and water flows is visible. There is only the sound of the wheels on the smooth ice surface. CUT TO: 84. 116   EXT. JIMMY'S GARAGE, RIVER'S EDGE -   NIGHT                116 Jimmy's is dark. Ray and Lila sit a minute. Then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Blow the horn. Ray honks the horn. A light comes on. Jimmy runs outside in a t-shirt. Lila rolls down the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Heat wave!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got a run for us, Jimmy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's pretty slow after Christmas. Unless you wanna to go off the Rez, there's a guy up in Montreal who's usually got heads.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How far?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Twenty miles or so. But...you gotta watch out for the Mounties and the Surete. and...this guy deals in ya' know girls. 117   EXT./INT. ACCLAIM, QUEBEC HIGHWAY     -   SAME             117 Ray and Lila drive down a Quebec highway. The road signs are in French. The skyline of Montreal is an orange glow in the far distance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have you ever been there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A few times. Have you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, Troy didn't like to travel. He liked to work in his shed, mostly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Ray and Lila drive down a commercial strip of shopping centers, fast food joints and strip clubs, with French names.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Up there. That's it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can't miss that. 118   EXT. LE CLUB SUPER SEXE - SAME                             118 Ray pulls in at a giant neon silhouette of a naked woman. They drive around back and get out. THROBBING DISCO music is heard from inside a door marked "Prive." 119   INT. CLUB SUPER SEXE - NIGHT                               119 They walk in. The place is mostly empty. There is a scantily dressed BARTENDER and JACQUES BRUNO sitting at the bar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oui?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bruno. She points to Bruno. Lila and Ray approach him. He is on his cell phone speaking in French. He looks them over, then closes up his telephone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You looking for a job.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, Jimmy called-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh yeah, Jimmy. Okay. He calls over the Bartender. She comes over. He points to Ray and Lila. She walks over to them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Put your hands up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Ray and Lila put up their hands. The Bartender pat frisks them for body wires. When she is finished:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay we go. He picks up his full-length fur coat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: D'is way. They follow him out the back of the club. The Bartender follows. 120   EXT. PARKING LOT, CLUB SUPER SEXE - SAME                   120 They wait.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: D'at your car? He points to the Acclaim parked a few feet away. They nod. He walks out to a shed and unlocks the door. Two very young CHINESE GIRLS, sickly and pale, wearing jean jackets look vacantly out. Bruno signals them to get out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Open the trunk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We need to get paid, first.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, yes. He pulls a wad of cash from inside his coat and hands it to Lila. She counts it out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You only got six hundred here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You get the rest at drop off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's six hundred apiece. The girls stand shivering by the trunk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's the deal I make with Jimmy, now you want to change? Lila and Ray look at each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's twelve hundred.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want to make a problem? Bruno glances at the Bartender watching from the back door of the club.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (annoyed by Ray) ...because you're not making a problem for me. And you're making a problem for them. Let me show you something. He approaches the two girls. He grabs one of the girls by the hair, kicks her in the back of the knees forcing her to the ground. Lila looks at Ray. The girl tries to get on her feet, but each time she does he kicks her in the back of the knees again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Ray) Let's just go. Held up by her hair, the girl slides around helplessly. Lila winces at the sight. Ray stares at Bruno.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. We'll take them. Lila looks at Ray. Bruno drops the girl who scrambles to her feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just open the trunk. Lila leans into the passenger side of the Acclaim and pops the trunk. Bruno looks at Ray:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You must be the brains of the operation. He motions the girls into the trunk and shuts it after them. Lila get in the passenger side and Bruno starts for the back door of the club. Ray pulls her gun out of her jacket and aims it at Bruno.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Turn around! Bruno stops and turns around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want the rest. He opens his fur coat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cool) I don't have any more. In the shiny coat lining only the handle of a long pistol is visible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to the Bartender) Go get it. Bruno looks around and nods at the bartender. The bartender panics not knowing what to do and begins speaking in French to Bruno. Ray shoots at the pavement beside Bruno.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to the bartender) Give it to her. The Bartender disappears into the club. Ray waits with the gun on Bruno.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (from inside the Acclaim) Let's get out of here. I'll give you the rest of the money.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. But thanks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're gonna get us all killed. A moment later the Bartender comes back, shaking and holding cash.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Put it there. She indicates the trunk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to the bartender) You aren't so smart as you look. Ray grabs the money and still pointing at Bruno, backs into the car. Bruno reaches for his pistol and aims at them as the Acclaim squeals away. Bruno FIRES shattering the driver's side window, grazing Ray's head. Ray falls back, dazed for a moment. Lila steers. Then Ray takes the wheel as they swerve out onto the main road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He shot me. Ray wipes the blood from her forehead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You should'a just taken the money from me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (blood streams down her face) I'm tired of people stealing from me.    Is it all there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We gotta get outta here, first.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just COUNT IT and make sure it's all there! Ray hands her the wad of money. Lila struggles to put on her glasses and counts out the money.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is it there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's all there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Slow down a little. We gotta keep it under the speed limit. Ray smiles and wipes away the blood. They drive a short distance. Ray checks the rear-view mirror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We gotta get off this road. Lila looks in the rear view. Headlights appear behing them. Ray speeds up approaching an intersection: the sign reads "ARRET" LILA (CONT'D) Slow down!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't. Lila looks back in the rear view mirror. The headlights are gaining on them. She SPEEDS through it. A local SURETE DE QUEBEC police cruiser parked out of sight TAKES OFF after her, LIGHTS FLASHING. 121   INT. ACCLAIM ON QUEBEC ROADS - NIGHT                       121 LILA We gotta get off this road! 122   EXT. ACCLAIM ON DIRT ROAD - NIGHT                          122 Ray swerves off the main road to a DIRT ROAD. The Quebec police follow. Ray swerves off the road and across a field into the WOODS and kills the HEADLIGHTS. The Quebec Cruiser CHASES them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 123   INT. ACCLAIM ON DIRT ROAD       - NIGHT                   123 Ray speeds down the road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How much farther to the reservation?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just up at the tree line. Ray speeds towards it, but the Quebec cruiser still pursues them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell? We're on the reservation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They can't arrest us but if they catch us they'll take the money.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit! Ray bounces into the woods through the trees. 124   EXT. ACCLAIM ON RIVER BANK - NIGHT                        124 The Acclaim emerges from the woods at the edge of the river. The International Seaway Bridge looms above the ice surface of the river. 125   INT. ACCLAIM ON RIVER BANK - NIGHT                        125 Behind them the flashing lights close in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That ice is black out here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will it hold us?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. Ray looks at her for a moment then drives toward the ice. 126   EXT. RIVER BANK - NIGHT                                   126 Behind them, the Quebec cruiser BRAKES at the edge of the river.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The Quebec officer GETS OUT TO WATCH the Acclaim drive out across the ice. He radios to: 127   EXT. INTERNATIONAL SEAWAY BRIDGE - NIGHT                   127 A BORDER GUARD picks up the phone. He nods, then hangs up and makes a call to... 128   INT. NEW YORK STATE CRUISER - NIGHT                        128 Trooper Napoli hears the call on the police radio.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...the Quebec Surete in pursuit of a vehicle with New York State plates, identified as a blue Plymouth Acclaim and the suspects are two women, suspected to be carrying illegals... He recognizes the car and u-turns. 129   INT. ACCLAIM ON FROZEN RIVER - NIGHT                       129 Ray and Lila hold their breath as they cross the river. They make it over the midpoint and Ray accelerates toward the shore. Two hundred feet from the bank, the BACK RIGHT TIRE HITS A CRACK in the ice. The TIRE DROPS and the UNDER BELLY of the car SCRAPES THE ICE. SPARKS FLY. The RIGHT REAR END of the car DROPS DOWN and the FRONT LEFT TIRE LIFTS off the ice. The car TEETERS BACK AND FORTH. Ray and Lila sit perfectly still.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We gotta crawl out the window. Lila rolls down her window. The car shifts. The wad of cash SLIDES toward the edge of the dashboard. Ray grabs it. Lila pops the trunk. The two Chinese girls scramble out. The four begin RUNNING FOR THE SHORE. ANGLE FROM THE UNDER THE BRIDGE: Trooper Napoli watches the action on the ice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 130   EXT. ACCLAIM ON FROZEN RIVER - NIGHT                       130 The CAR SINKS DEEPER INTO THE WATER on one side. 131   EXT. FROZEN RIVER - NIGHT                                  131 Ray, Lila and the Chinese girls keep running, slipping and sliding, falling. Lila and Ray stop and go back to help one of the Chinese girls who keeps falling. When they get to the shore, they climb up the bank and collapse on the snow, gasping. ANGLE: Trooper Napoli gets in his cruiser and heads down the bank toward the women, lights flashing. 132   EXT. RIVER BANK - NIGHT                                    132 Two headlights are seen in the distance coming toward them. A PICKUP TRUCK approaches along the shore. Jimmy drives it. He gets out, gathers Ray, Lila and the two Chinese girls into the back of the truck and drives away. Ray looks back as the Acclaim SLIPS THROUGH THE ICE AND DISAPPEARS. Trooper Napoli reaches the scene, too late. No one is there. 133   INT. VILLAGE BAKERY - NIGHT                                133 A small house on the river's edge with a hand painted sign:"Bakery" Jimmy drives up. He helps Ray, Lila and the Chinese girls to the door. The Ticket Taker, "VELMA" opens the door, wearing an apron.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi Mom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jimmy, I told you not to bring no more half frozen people in here off the river.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We just need to borrow your oven, Mom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He leads them, wet and freezing, to the bakery kitchen. As they go by Velma and Ray recognize each other. 134   INT. VILLAGE BAKERY, KITCHEN - NIGHT                      134 An industrial oven sits beside an old couch. Lila, Ray and the teenage girls stand near it shivering. Velma looks them over, frowning and shakes her head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't see how I can get any baking done. I'm supposed to be baking 200 doughnuts for pee wee Lacrosse and now I have people bleeding and dripping all over my kitchen. She opens a closet filled with Indian medicine plants and takes out several kinds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sit down, I can't reach up that high. Ray sits down. Velma reaches up and dabs Ray's grazed and bleeding forehead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Looks like somebody tried to blow your brains out. Ray winces in pain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get outta here, Jimmy. They gotta strip down. (to girls) Gimme those jackets. Velma motions to the Chinese girls to take off their coats. They stare at her shivering. She gently goes to one of the girls and helps her out of her jean jacket. Under it she wears a short sleeved shirt showing her bruised arms. Velma sees the bruises.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Somebody's been beatin' up on you. Lila and Ray see the girl's black and blue arms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Velma hangs the girl's jacket on the big oven to dry and gives her an old blanket to keep warm. Then Velma turns to Lila.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You, too. 135   INT. MOHAWK TRIBAL POLICE STATION - NIGHT                  135 MOHAWK CHIEF OF POLICE, BILLY THREE RIVERS, a stressed- looking man in his 40's talks on the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -Good, good Mike. What can I do for you? - -You say non-native smugglers?
direction.name: direction

location: NIGHT 135 MOHAWK CHIEF OF POLICE, BILLY THREE RIVERS,

direction.raw_text: white woman? On the Rez? -I'll look into it and give you a call back. Sure thing. (pause) -I'll take your request to the Tribal Council and give you a call back. -No problem, Mike. You bet. 136   INT. MOHAWK TRIBAL COUNCIL - NIGHT                         136 Billy Three Rivers sits down at a long conference table. A middle-aged Mohawk woman, "BARBARA" sits behind a name plate reading "CHIEF". At the end of the table Bernie sits behind another name plate: "SUB-CHIEF." Rosalie comes in wearing her coat over her bathrobe and takes her place behind the "GRAND CHIEF" name plate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi, Rosalie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Billy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have a situation with a couple smugglers. They got chased by the Quebec police and crossed the river but their car went in and now the troopers know they're on the Rez.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lila Littlewolf and some white woman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do the troopers want?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A surrender of the two illegals and the Non-Native smuggler. They need an example here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you know where they are?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Probably over at Velma's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to the other Chiefs) What do you think?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Turn them in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about Lila Littlewolf?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We got our own court system.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We don't charge people with smuggling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe we should.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If we did, we'd have to arrest half the people on the Rez. Rosalie and Barbara shoot him an ANGRY STARE. He shrugs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We can expel her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can't start throwin' Mohawks off the Rez, Rosalie. There's only, what, six thousand of us as it is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She makes the Mohawk people look bad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But she has a Mohawk son.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She cost us a Mohawk son.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jake was a big boy. He knew what he was doin'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She'll never be anything but a smuggler.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We've had smuggling on the Rez since Al Capone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then we'll take a vote. 137   EXT. ROUTE 37, THE RESERVATION LINE - NIGHT               137 Two New York State Cruisers block the road, lights flashing. 138   INT. VILLAGE BAKERY, KITCHEN - NIGHT                      138 The bell on the bakery door RINGS. Billy Three Rivers walks in looking very official. Jimmy opens the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi, Billy. He comes in and Velma walks in from the kitchen closing the door behind her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Velma, seen any smugglers tonight? Velma says nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, Billy, you never bothered with smugglers before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rosalie is worried people are gonna think the Mohawks let in terrorists. Plus, I got the Troopers on my back. They want the illegals and they say there's some white lady with them too. Is that true, Jimmy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Jimmy looks away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got white women doing it now? Jesus. (after a moment) Well, if you see any, let me know. Three Rivers leaves. 139   INT. VILLAGE BAKERY, KITCHEN - NIGHT                      139 Lila and Ray LISTEN from the kitchen. Ray eyes the back door. Ray grabs her jacket off the oven and takes half the cash out of the pocket and hands it to Lila.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I gotta go. Lila takes the money. The Chinese girls look on confused. One gets up and grabs her jacket, but Ray motions her back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. You stay here. Ray hurries to the back door, opens it, but Bernie Littlewolf is there. At the sight of him, Ray backs up. He walks in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi, Lila.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi Bernie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're in a lot of trouble. Lila looks at him, unfazed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The council voted to expel you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Expel me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For five years. You can appeal, but you'll never be able to change Rosalie's mind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They can't do that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They'll make your life miserable if you try to stay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They've already done that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Believe me, it could get even worse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought this was all legal on the reservation. Bernie ignores her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Lila) Look, I gotta get home. She moves for the door, but Bernie blocks her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If she leaves, they'll turn you in Lila. The troopers want somebody.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But, she's a Mohawk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Chiefs want her out, so there's nothing standing between her and the troopers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen, my kids got no one but me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you leave she won't see her son again. Ray and Bernie stare at each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let her go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lila, you're giving up on him and he's only one year old.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just go. Ray goes to the door, but turns around...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At least you got family to take care of him, ya' know? 140   EXT. RESERVATION WOODS - NIGHT                           140 Ray shuts the door behind her and starts toward the river. She turns and runs along the bank...a long way...then slows down. Breathing hard, she stops. Snow melts on her face. A long moment passes. The sound of the river ice pushing against the bank releases a long, deep moan all around her. 141   INT. VILLAGE BAKERY, KITCHEN -NIGHT                      141 Lila and Bernie sit on the old sofa by the big oven.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He might be better off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jake wouldn't agree with that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was all for a new crib. I wanted the baby to have a pretty new crib, not some handmedown. And he wouldn't let me go alone. (laughs) I was too fat to get behind the steering wheel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He wanted to keep you and little Jake safe. The back door opens. Ray is there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's just a few months, right? Bernie and Lila turn around. Ray walks in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got baby stuff in the shed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . She takes the folded double-wide contract out of her pocket and holds it out to Lila.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get a good used single wide with insulation. Insulation is the key thing. Versailles will give you a hard time, but that will leave enough for you and the boys to live on for a couple of months. Ricky's allergic to penicillin.(a moment) And you can't feed `em Pringles all the time. Okay? Lila isn't sure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay? Lila nods her head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you gotta get there quick, before the police, `cause T.J. will get scared. I don't want him to get scared, you know. Ray chokes back her own tears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. Lila takes the contract from Ray.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And don't let him jerk you around. Versailles, I mean. (to Bernie) Go with her. Okay? Bernie nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure. 142   INT. RAY'S TRAILER - NIGHT                               142 T.J. and Ricky eat supper to the glow of the TV in the background.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I have more corn? T.J. dumps his own corn onto Ricky's plate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 143   EXT. ROUTE 37, THE RESERVATION LINE - NIGHT                143 Flashing dome lights of New York State troopers are seen just beyond the sign "YOU ARE NOW LEAVING THE LAND OF THE MOHAWK." Trooper Napoli waits in his cruiser with other vehicles. Billy drives Ray and the Chinese girls slowly toward them in the Mohawk Tribal Police Cruiser. Billy stops and the three get out of the car, handcuffed. 144   EXT. HOUSE ON POINT - NIGHT                                144 Bernie waits in the car. Lila walks to the front door. Thunder looks up from beside the front step.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry, Thunder, I got nothing for you. She knocks. Evelyn opens the door. Seeing Lila she tries to close it, but Lila WEDGES herself inside. 145   INT. HOUSE ON POINT - NIGHT                                145 Evelyn tires to push her out, but Lila walks in the house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you want? Lila walks up to the Little Jake sitting in his high chair, his face covered in carrots. She reaches out to touch him, but Evelyn pushes her hand away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I need his coat. Lila picks up the baby, and looks around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's his coat?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can't have him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . She grabs Lila's arm, but Lila shakes her arm free and wraps Little Jake in her own jacket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Say goodbye to your Dudah. Evelyn stands in front of the door, blocking Lila. Lila stops and they stand for a moment looking at each other. There is anger and sadness. Evelyn moves aside. Lila walks out with the baby. 146   EXT. HOUSE ON POINT - NIGHT                                146 Bernie stands by the car holding a CAR SEAT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's gonna kill me for taking this out of her car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 147   INT. NEW YORK STATE TROOPER CRUISER - NIGHT                147 Ray sits in the backseat. The two Chinese girls beside her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How long is it for me. You know if I confess?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As long as they're not on a watch list. Four months. He glances around at them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't think you have much to worry about judging from the look of them, probably brought here to work in the sex trade. Ray looks at the two girls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will they get sent back?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not necessarily. They can apply for asylum.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I have a cigarette? He lights one for her. She takes it, shaking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is there somebody I can call for you? To take care of your children.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got somebody. He looks back at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A relative.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A friend. Trooper Napoli looks at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I need to call my kid. 148   INT RAY'S TRAILER - NIGHT                                148 The phone rings. T.J. picks it up. T.J. (O.S.) Hello. Hi, Mom. She hears his voice and can't speak. T.J. (CONT'D) -Mom are you there? What's wrong? -What kinda trouble? -What did you do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: smuggler!? Holy shit! -Are you in jail? -But are you're going to jail!? There is a long silence. He wipes a tear away with his sleeve. Ricky plays with his Hot Wheels on the floor. T.J. (CONT'D) -Yeah, okay. What does that mean? But why? I can take care of him, I do it all the time. But I don't see why we need-? (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . T.J. (CONT'D) -Who? (pause) A baby? No way. -Yeah I know where the stuff is. It's in the shed, but that's so stupid!. A KNOCK at the door. T.J. looks at it, unsure what to do. T.J. (CONT'D) (holding phone) -Yeah, I'm here. Somebody's at the door. He walks to it and opens it holding the phone. Lila is standing there holding Little Jake, wrapped in her jean jacket. T.J. and Lila look at each other.   She walks in. T.J. (CONT'D) -Okay. Bye. He hangs up. Little Jake sees Ricky playing with the Hot Wheels Set and reaches to get down. Lila puts him on the floor. He crawls toward the Christmas tree and the Hot Wheels set. T.J. (CONT'D) (to Ricky ) You're gonna have to get the little pieces up high -- or he'll eat them. 149   INT. NEW YORK STATE TROOPER CRUISER - NIGHT               149 Ray rides in the back of the Cruiser. They pass by trailer homes decorated for Christmas. 150   EXT. ROUTE 37 - DAY                                       150 A Semi ROARS down the road with "WIDE LOAD" banner hauling a single wide mobile home through the bright morning light, plastic covering rippling in the wind. 151   EXT. RAY'S TRAILER - DAY                                  151 Using the blow torch, T.J. works on the smiling duck Kiddie ride. 106. Ricky plays with Little Jake, dressed in a snow suit. Lila comes outside with a plate of peanut butter sandwiches, badly made. T.J. signals Ricky who brings Little Jake over and puts him on the Kiddie ride. Ricky holds him on the seat and T.J. flips a switch. The ride JERKS a few times then starts to move back and fourth. Little Jake smiles. Behind T.J. a Mohawk Tribal Police Cruiser drives up. Billy Two Rivers gets out and walks up to T.J. He speaks sternly to T.J., pointing at the cruiser where an elderly and frail Mohawk women in her eighties, Mrs. ThreeRivers, looks out the window. T.J. walks over to the cruiser. She rolls down the window. He says something to her, looking at the ground as he speaks. Ricky and Lila holding Little Jake look on. Billy Two Rivers drives away. SUDDENLY T.J. and Ricky LOOK UP. A RUMBLE is heard in the distance. From down the road the SEMI is seen APPROACHING... T.J. smiles and Ricky watches not sure whether to believe it or not. He takes T.J.'s hand. CUT TO: 152   INT. NEW SINGLE-WIDE MOBILE HOME - NIGHT                   152 Ray is asleep in her new bedroom with wall-to-wall carpet and a big window. Her cell phone RINGS. She doesn't move.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi, (happy) You've reached Ray. Leave me a message and I'll get back to you just as soon as I can. The tone is heard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ray, are you gonna pick up or not? (MORE)
direction.name: direction
